muxed.title: Create/Manage Muxed Account
muxed.explainer: Create alias addresses (M...) with a unique muxed ID for an existing account. The alias address will always point to the same account.

info.title: What is a Muxed account?
info.intro1: Ein Muxed‚ÄëKonto kombiniert eine normale Konto‚ÄëAdresse (G‚ÄëAdresse) mit einer zus√§tzlichen 64‚ÄëBit‚ÄëMuxed‚ÄëID.
info.intro2: Technisch ist es ein Alias, der immer auf dasselbe Basis‚ÄëKonto zeigt, aber durch die ID eindeutig unterscheidbar ist.
info.purposeText: Muxed‚ÄëKonten dienen dazu, viele Unterkonten unter einer einzigen Stellar‚ÄëAdresse zu verwalten ‚Äì ideal, wenn viele Ein‚Äë/Auszahlungen √ºber ein gemeinsames Hauptkonto laufen, aber jeder Vorgang einer Person, Abteilung oder einem Projekt zugeordnet werden muss.

examples.ex1: Firmenzahlungen: Jede Mitarbeiterin/jeder Mitarbeiter erh√§lt eine eigene Muxed‚ÄëID, damit Lohnzahlungen eindeutig zugeordnet werden k√∂nnen.
examples.ex2: B√∂rsen oder Plattformen: Jede/r Benutzer/in erh√§lt eine eigene Muxed‚ÄëID, damit Einzahlungen √ºber ein gemeinsames Wallet automatisch richtig verbucht werden.
examples.ex3: Projects or sub-accounts: An organization can allocate budgets or revenues to individual projects.
examples.ex4: Kundenzuordnung: Eine M‚ÄëAdresse pro Kunde; die ID entspricht der Kunden‚ÄëID ‚Äì Zahlungen sind eindeutig zuordenbar, auch ohne Memo.
examples.ex5: Services without memos: Differentiate deposits when the service does not support memos.
examples.ex6: Auszahlungen/Gehaltsl√§ufe: Eine M‚ÄëAdresse pro Mitarbeiter/Partner f√ºr interne Buchhaltung und Reports.
examples.ex7: Shop/Bestellungen: Pro Bestellung eine M‚ÄëAdresse; R√ºckerstattungen lassen sich der Bestellung zuordnen.
examples.ex8: Departments/Cost Centers: IDs as cost centers; automatically group payments by area.
examples.ex9: Multi‚ÄëTenant‚ÄëDienste: Jeder Mandant erh√§lt eine eigene M‚ÄëAdresse unter demselben Basiskonto.

info.pageTitle: What this page does in the SKM
info.pageDesc: Diese Seite dient zur Verwaltung der Muxed‚ÄëKonten deines aktuell gew√§hlten Stellar‚ÄëKontos:

createItems.i1: Erzeugt neue Muxed‚ÄëAdressen (M...) aus deiner Basisadresse (G...).
createItems.i2: Optional with label (Name) and note (z. B. Projekt oder Zweck).

importItems.i1: Massenanlage von Muxed‚ÄëKonten, z. B. aus einer Mitarbeiterliste.

exportItems.i1: Export all saved entries as CSV.
exportItems.i2: Fields: basePublicKey, muxedId, muxedAddress, label, note, createdAt.

templateItems.i1: Erstellt eine leere CSV‚ÄëDatei mit Spalten√ºberschriften muxedId,label,note.
templateItems.i2: N√ºtzlich f√ºr HR‚Äë oder Buchhaltungsabteilungen zur Vorbereitung neuer Eintr√§ge.

manageItems.i1: Alle gespeicherten Muxed‚ÄëAdressen werden in einer Tabelle angezeigt.
manageItems.i2: Auswahl, L√∂schen sowie Label‚Äë/Notizpflege direkt m√∂glich.

info.shortText: Muxed‚ÄëKonten machen dein Stellar‚ÄëKonto feingranular und buchbar ‚Äì ideal f√ºr Organisationen, die viele Zahlungen √ºber ein zentrales Konto abwickeln, aber trotzdem jede Transaktion eindeutig zuordnen m√∂chten.

error.thresholdTooHigh: Thresholds must not exceed the sum of the weights.
error.safetyBlocked: Security check blocked: Please resolve the warnings above.
error.noActiveSigners: At least one active signer is required. Suggestion: Set master weight > 0 or add a signer with weight > 0.
error.noEd25519Signers: At least one signer with weight > 0 is required. Suggestion: Increase master weight or add signer.
error.masterZeroInsufficientHigh: Master weight is 0 and the sum of the signer weights does not meet the high threshold (Sum: {{sum}}, High: {{high}}). Suggestion: Lower the thresholds or increase weights/signers.
error.thresholdHighUnreachable: High threshold not reachable (Sum: {{sum}}, High: {{high}}). Suggestion: lower threshold or increase weights/signers.
error.thresholdMedUnreachable: Med-threshold not reachable (Sum: {{sum}}, Med: {{med}}). Suggestion: Lower the threshold or increase weights/signers.
error.specialSignerLastHigh: Special-Signer (hashX/preAuthTx) should not be the sole high authority. Suggestion: add signers with a weight >= high.
error.setOptionsNotSignable: SetOptions would not be signable after the change (Signer Sum: {{sum}}, High: {{high}}). Suggestion: increase signer weight or lower high.

warning.highSingleSigner: Only one signer reaches the high threshold. Recommendation: at least two independent signers.
warning.medSingleSigner: Med-threshold > 0, but only one signatory present. Recommendation: add a second signatory.

securityGuarantee.title: üîí SKM Security Guarantee (Multisig)
securityGuarantee.text:
The Stellar Account Manager prevents all technically induced account locks that may arise from incorrect multisig configuration.

Specifically, SKM blocks:
- Disabling the master key without accessible signers
- Inaccessible thresholds (low / med / high)
- Sequence errors in signer and threshold changes
- Removing the last valid high signer
- Multisig setups where SetOptions can no longer be signed
- Dead ends due to hashX or preAuthTx as the final signer

SKM only sets ed25519 signers. For other signer types, use {link}.

SKM guarantees:
- Every confirmed change leaves at least one valid path open for further account management
- SetOptions remains accessible after the change

Not guaranteed (systembedingt):
- Loss of secret keys or hardware wallets
- Inaccessibility or failure of external signers

Conclusion:
SKM reliably protects against configuration lockouts.
Organizational risks are transparently displayed but cannot be technically prevented.

multisigEdit.signerTypeNote: Note: SKM only uses ed25519 signers. For hashX/preAuthTx, use

validation.signerKeyInvalid: Invalid signer address. A G‚Ä¶ address (ed25519) is expected.

publicKey.label: Please enter the source federation address or the public key:

secretKey.info:
‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT: This website NEVER stores your Secret Key!

The Secret Key displayed here exists only in your browser (lokal im Arbeitsspeicher). As soon as you reload or leave the page, it is irretrievably lost.

Copy or note down the Secret Key immediately after generating it, before closing the page.

Verification: You can verify using the browser developer tools (F12 ‚Üí Network) that no Secret Key is transmitted externally. Only signed transactions are sent, never your Secret Key.
secretKey.label: Enter the source secret key (S-Key)
secretKey.mismatch: Secret key does not match the public address.

remember.label: Remember the secret key for this session
remember.hint: When enabled, the key will be saved until the tab is closed and reused for further payments.

secretKey.clearSessionHint: Removes the secret key stored in this session (will be deleted anyway when the tab is closed).

glossary.pageIntro: Here you will find important words from the blockchain world and the Stellar network. Everything is explained in simple terms.
glossary.searchPlaceholder: Search term (z. B. Konto, Account, Muxed)
glossary.searchHint: The search finds words and explanations.

blockchain.title: Blockchain
blockchain.short: Gemeinsames digitales Kassenbuch ‚Äì viele Computer speichern die gleichen Eintr√§ge.
blockchain.desc: A blockchain is like a digital ledger. Many computers store the same entries, so no one can secretly alter anything.

wallet.title: Wallet
wallet.short: Digital wallet that manages your keys.
wallet.desc: A wallet is your digital purse. It manages the keys you need to access your account and send transactions. A wallet can be a program or an app, or even just a piece of paper with your private key.

account.title: Account
account.short: A blockchain account can hold assets and send transactions.
account.desc: An account is the place on the blockchain where your assets are stored. An account has a public address that begins with G. Multiple wallets can access the same account if they have the correct key.

addressG.title: G-address
addressG.short: The public main address of a Stellar account (beginnt mit G).
addressG.desc: The G-address is the main address of a Stellar account. It starts with the letter G. You give it to others so they can send you something.

publicKey.title: Public key
publicKey.short: Adresse, die du teilen darfst; bei Stellar meist die G‚ÄëAdresse.
publicKey.desc: The public key is the address you are allowed to show. In Stellar, this is the G-address. Others use it to send you money.

privateKey.title: Secret key
privateKey.short: Password for the account ‚Äì never share.
privateKey.desc: The secret key is your password for the account. Whoever has this key can move your money. Never share it.

addressFederation.title: Federation address
addressFederation.short: Kurze Adresse wie E‚ÄëMail, zeigt auf eine G‚ÄëAdresse.
addressFederation.desc: A federation address looks like an email. Example: name*domain.com. This short address points to a regular G address. It is easier to remember.

addressMuxed.title: Muxed account
addressMuxed.short: M‚ÄëAdresse mit zus√§tzlicher ID ‚Äì teilt ein Basiskonto.
addressMuxed.desc: An M-address points to an existing Stellar account but additionally has its own number (ID). This allows, for example, for distinguishing between multiple people or departments under the same G-address. Technically, the money still belongs to the main account.

multisig.title: Multisignature
multisig.short: Important actions require more than a signature.
multisig.desc: Multi-Sig stands for multiple signatures. An important action requires more than one key. For example, you and a second key must both agree before something is sent. This makes theft more difficult.

trustline.title: Trustline
trustline.short: Consent to hold a token from a specific issuer.
trustline.desc:
A trustline is like a "Yes, I accept this token." By setting up a trustline, you are indicating that your account is prepared to hold a specific token from a particular issuer. Without a trustline, you cannot receive that token.

Example: A trustline is specified as CODE:ISSUER. For EURT from the issuer GDUKMGUGDZQK6Y‚Ä¶, it is EURT:GDUKMGUGDZQK6Y‚Ä¶.

token.title: Token
token.short: Digital unit ‚Äì e.g., money, points, or credit.
token.desc: A token is a digital unit on the blockchain. A token can represent money, points, or credits for a service.

asset.title: Asset
asset.short: Tokens on Stellar are always linked to an issuer.
asset.desc: On Stellar, a token is called an asset. An asset is always linked to an issuing account. For example, an account can issue a Euro token. This Euro token would then be an asset.

xlm.title: XLM
xlm.short: Native currency of Stellar for fees and activation.
xlm.desc: XLM is the base currency of Stellar. You need XLM to pay fees and to initiate a new account.

mainnet.title: Mainnet
mainnet.desc: The real Stellar network with actual value. Transactions are final, and fees are paid in genuine XLM.

testnet.title: Testnet
testnet.short: Public practice network with no real value.
testnet.desc: A public practice network. Tokens have no real value. Ideal for learning and experimenting without risk.

memo.title: Memo
memo.desc: A memo is a small note that you can send along with a transaction. Often, an exchange requires a specific memo to know to whom the money belongs.

transaction.title: Transaction
transaction.short: Action on the blockchain, e.g., payment or trustline.
transaction.desc: A transaction is an action on the blockchain, such as sending money or establishing a trustline. A transaction is permanently stored once it is confirmed.

fee.title: Fee
fee.desc: The fee is a very small amount that you pay with each transaction. The fee goes to the network. With Stellar, the fees are very small.

ledger.title: Ledger
ledger.short: Chain of confirmed data and account balances.
ledger.desc: The ledger is the chain of all confirmed data. It shows which accounts hold how much and which transactions have occurred. Anyone can check the ledger.

horizon.title: Horizon
horizon.short: API‚ÄëDienst, √ºber den Apps mit Stellar sprechen.
horizon.desc: Horizon is the service that allows programs to communicate with the Stellar Blockchain. Our tool queries Horizon to load account balances and transactions.

anchor.title: Anchor
anchor.short: Firma, die Fiat‚ÄëGeld mit Stellar verbindet.
anchor.desc: An anchor is a company that connects real money such as Euro or Dollar with Stellar. For example, you give the anchor Euros and receive a Euro token on Stellar in return.

exchange.title: Stock exchange
exchange.short: Place to buy and sell tokens.
exchange.desc: An exchange is a place where you can buy or sell tokens. Many exchanges require a KYC process, meaning an identity verification, before you can withdraw money in euros or francs.

dex.title: DEX
dex.short: Decentralized exchange directly on the blockchain.
dex.desc: DEX means Decentralized Exchange. Here, people trade directly with each other on the blockchain. There is no single operator. Stellar has a DEX built directly into it.

liquidityPool.title: Liquidity pool
liquidityPool.short: A shared pool with two tokens for immediate exchange.
liquidityPool.desc: A liquidity pool is a shared pot containing two tokens. People deposit both tokens into it. Others can then instantly exchange these tokens. The depositors earn small fees for this service.

balanceClaimable.title: Claimable Balance
balanceClaimable.short: Reserved money that you still need to accept.
balanceClaimable.desc: A claimable balance is money that has already been reserved for you, but you still need to claim it. Only when you accept it does it go into your account.

protocolUpdate.title: Protocol Update
protocolUpdate.desc: A protocol update is an upgrade of the rules in the Stellar network, such as new features or security changes. All nodes in the network must use the same rules.

soroban.title: Soroban
soroban.desc: Soroban is the smart contract system of Stellar. A smart contract is program code on the blockchain. The code can independently verify rules and trigger actions without a bank in between.

mode.realWarning: Attention: Genuine Trustline(s) will be deleted

deleted.notFound: No deletable trust lines found ‚Äì all still contain balances.

trustline.nonZeroBalance: This trustline cannot be deleted because it still holds a balance.
trustline.onlyZeroBalanceInfo: Only trustlines with a balance of 0 can be deleted.

tz.note: Date and time are interpreted in the selected time zone and automatically converted to UTC before searching.

flag.compromised: Warning: This recipient is marked as compromised in your trusted list.
flag.deactivated: Note: This recipient is marked as disabled in your trusted list.

lesson1.title: A blockchain is a distributed digital ledger that records transactions across multiple computers in such a way that the registered transactions cannot be altered retroactively. This technology is decentralized and is most commonly associated with cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin. Each block in the chain contains several transactions, and every time a new transaction occurs on the blockchain, a record of that transaction is added to each participant's ledger. The decentralized nature of blockchain ensures immutability and security of the data.
lesson1.task: Assemble the modules (Transaktionen) into a chain
lesson1.learningOutcome: A blockchain is an immutable digital ledger that everyone can collectively verify.

lesson2.title: Understand Stellar
lesson2.goal: Know the difference from other blockchains
lesson2.task: Send token to friend (Simulation) and see speed
lesson2.learningOutcome: Stellar is fast, inexpensive, and has no mining.

lesson3.title: Public & Privacy
lesson3.task: View a public transaction and guess whether one can identify the sender.
lesson3.learningOutcome: Everything is visible, but no one knows the real name.

lesson4.title: Your account
lesson4.goal: Understanding the structure and significance of Public/Secret Key
lesson4.task: Matching Game: What is public, what is secret
lesson4.learningOutcome: Only the secret key grants access; the public key may be shared.

lesson5.title: Send & Receive
lesson5.goal: Understanding the functioning of transactions and trustlines
lesson5.task: Execute test shipment and view fee
lesson5.learningOutcome: Each transaction incurs a small fee; trustline = permission to receive.

lesson6.title: Token & Trading
lesson6.task: Place a token on a virtual marketplace and monitor price changes.
lesson6.learningOutcome: Price is determined by supply and demand.

lesson7.title: Security
lesson7.task: Sorting right/wrong actions; detecting fake tokens
lesson7.learningOutcome: Keep the key confidential, store it securely, and use the testnet.

lesson8.title: Verification & Identity
lesson8.learningOutcome: KYC = Identity verification, verification demonstrates trustworthy tokens.

lesson9.title: Zero Knowledge
lesson9.task: Example scenario 'I am over 18' without showing date of birth.
lesson9.learningOutcome: One can prove something without revealing secrets.

lesson10.title: Practice with SKM
lesson10.task: Create an account on the testnet, activate it, set a trustline, send tokens.
lesson10.learningOutcome: Trace the technical processes of a transaction.

lesson11.title: Responsibility
lesson11.task: Decision game: act correctly or not
lesson11.learningOutcome: Blockchain is final; due diligence is a must.

lesson12.title: Completion / Playful Learning
lesson12.learningOutcome: Review what you've learned, recognize your own progress.
